alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 01 at 2:18AM MDT until October 01 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY BETWEEN 1 PM AND 7 PM FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS... .A Pacific storm system will continue to move inland and strengthen over the Great Basin today. This disturbance will continue to spread strong winds, dry conditions, and unstable air over portions of northwest and west central New Mexico. This will lead to areas of elevated to critical fire weather conditions, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) from early afternoon through early this evening, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest winds strengthening to 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 13 to 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
